title: League hard crashes my computer exactly 2 seconds into the game.
body:
2 seconds into every game I try to play, everything freezes, my computer ignores all inputs and makes a buzzing noise(I have to just hold the power button for a hard shut down). Could it be drivers? If so how would I fix it? I wouldn't think that it is a hardware problem because it happens at the exact same time every time I try to play, but typically software problems don't cause hard crashes like this. I did not have this problem before patch 6.19. Could 6.19 have caused this problem? My computer is not even 2 years old.

Things I have tried:
System restore to before the last time I played and it worked. 
un-install re install(before and after the system restore)
Full virus scan
Repair league of legends

I am using a dell laptop with 8 gigs ram and an integrated graphics card. IDK if that is significant.
I would appreciate any suggestions or knowledge.
Thanks!

replies.body:
If you're running Windows 10, this is likely caused by the Xbox game bar that was recently updated to enable a feature called *Game DVR*. I recommend [disabling the game bar entirely](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) to see if it resolves this.

Let me know if this helped.

I can't believe that actually worked!! Thank you so much! After attempting multiple more difficult solutions, I feel kinda stupid lol.

But do you happen to know why this was only a problem after I patched to 6.19? 

Thanks again!

I don't think it was anything in the patch, it was likely caused by the Anniversary update for Windows 10 getting pushed out to your computer. That's the update that enabled this Game DVR business.

Let me know if you have any other questions.
Yeah I have never opened the Xbox app but somehow disabling that dvr SO FAR works thanks.
